div.p: STREET DESERVE TO BE LEFT ALONE. WISE UP, MAN.
>>> "FACTOR TIP OF THE DAY." IN 1959, THE "MANY LOVES OF DOBY
GILLIS" DEBUTED. IT BECAME MY FAVORITE SHOW.
>> OH, NOW, JUST A MINUTE. YOU AND I HAD A DATE AFTER
SCHOOL. >> DID WE?
>> YOU ARE DARN RIGHT WE DID. >> I DON'T REMEMBER YOU ASKED
ME. DIDN'T I COME UP AND ASK YOU TO
GO TO THE ICE CREAM PARLOR AFTER SCHOOL.
>> YES, I BELIEVE YOU DID. >> AND WHAT DID I SAY?
>> YOU SAID YES. >> WELL, YOU INTIMATED.
>> WHAT WERE MY EXACT WORDS? >> NO.
>> CORRECT. >> I DON'T BELIEVE THAT SHE
WISHES TO SPEAK TO YOU ANYMORE. >> HOW WOULD YOU LIKE TO KNOCKED
RIGHT ON YOUR FANCY PANTS? >> TAKE IT EASY, DOB.
HE'LL KILL YOU. >> THAT'S RIGHT, DOB, I'LL KILL
YOU. >> THAT'S RIGHT, YOU'LL KILL ME.
>> MAYNARD G. KREBS WAS HYSTERICAL.
NOW OUT ON DVD FOR THE FIRST TIME.
IN MY LIBRARY ALREADY. "FACTOR TIP OF THE DAY."
CHECK OUT THE FACTOR WEBSITE, DIFFERENT FROM BILLOREILLY.COM.
